column4: Germany's main rail operator reaches wage agreement with GDL union
column5: BERLIN (Reuters) - Deutsche Bahn [DBN.UL] has reached a wage agreement with train drivers’ union GDL, Germany’s largest railway operator and the union said on Friday, averting strikes in the railway sector.
column6: The agreement includes an overall pay rise of 6.1 percent over a period of two years and five months, state-owned Deutsche Bahn said in a statement.
column7: Deutsche Bahn already reached an agreement with larger EVG union in December, after a walkout that paralyzed rail traffic in large parts of Germany.
